discussion.content: Absolutely, the order makes sense.
It looks right
Right.

DRAG DROP -
A graphics printing company using Dynamics 365 Supply Chain Management sells 100 percent made-to-order signs. These signs cannot be pre-produced.
The company wants to create an end-to-end process that includes production, sales order packing, and sales order picking.
You need to determine the order of the functions.
In which order should you recommend the actions be performed? To answer, move all actions from the list of actions to the answer area and arrange them in the correct order.
Select and Place:
//IMG//

choices.D: Email the delegation policy to all managers.

questions.question_text:
An organization has implemented the accounts payable module in Dynamics 365 Finance.
Corporate policy specifies the following:
✑ Managers and directors are allowed to approve invoices for payment.
✑ Users are allowed to delegate their signing authority to other users when they are out of the office.
✑ Accounts payable workflow will be used to assist in automating the signing process.
✑ Users whose job has signing authority can approve invoices for payment.
You need to meet the organization's corporate policy.
What should you recommend?

discussion.content: It is the correct normal work flow process.

Selected Answer: A
Answer is A

questions.question_text:
DRAG DROP -
A client wants to create a custom view-only security role that allows users to view the customer list in the accounts receivable module. It must be accurately reported during a security audit.
You need to recommend how to implement the privileges.
Which five actions should you perform in sequence? To answer, move the appropriate actions from the list of actions to the answer area and arrange them in the correct order.
Select and Place:
//IMG//

discussion.content: It dosnt matter which way you do it, you can either start from the bottom or the top. I tend to do it this way though as its a bit easier to trace (as you have far fewer roles than privileges) also when you are doing this generally the role will require a combination of duties)
In my mind, create role could be after duty creation.
Correct

questions.question_text:
A trading company is concerned about the impact of General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) on their business.
The company needs to define personal data for their business purposes.
You need to define personal data as defined by GDPR.
Which three types of data are considered personal data? Each correct answer presents a complete solution.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

discussion.content: B, C and E are correct. Passwords are not considered as personal data as per GDPR so far.
Correct answer: B,C,E https://community.meraki.com/t5/Wireless-LAN/GDPR-compliance-of-event-logs-with-MAC-address/td-p/45265

comments.content: And that device is assigned to a person only, so maybe E is also considered.

The GDPR applies to data from which a living individual is identified or identifiable (by anyone), whether directly or indirectly, including online identifiers, device identifiers, cookie ID, biometric data, and IP addresses.
I don't think so because a MAC-adress relates to a device and not to a peronal.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BCE
BCE are correct

Selected Answer: BCE
B, C, E.

Selected Answer: BCE
BCE

https://commission.europa.eu/law/law-topic/data-protection/reform/what-personal-data_en#:~:text=The%20GDPR%20protects%20personal%20data,(for%20example%20alphabetical%20order).
Password is not a personal identifier

Correct answer: B, C, E
B, C, E

questions.question_text:
HOTSPOT -
A distribution center uses Dynamics 365 Supply Chain Management.
When product returns are received at the distribution center, they are inspected, and a replacement is sent to the customer. Customer service processes both the return receipts and replacement orders to speed up the process.
The system must be able to prevent a single user from completing an entire return process.
You need to recommend a solution.
What should you recommend? To answer, select the appropriate options in the answer area.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.
Hot Area:
//IMG//

comments.content: Is the second one not a field level security issue?

discussion.content:
For me it's :
- Security Role
- Security Role
- Segregation of duties
Shipment advice is a field-specific or button-specific function within a form and a business process. For me, it's more like: Security role, Field security, Segregation of duties rule

I think the anwser is correct.

All task are performed by Customer service, so the process should be performed by the same team. One of the requirement of the question is to pervent a single user to perform the whole process instead of asking to setup a the department hierarchy / setup different roles for certain users. 

So the anwser should not be likely to use the security role to limit the function.

comments.content: I don't quite agree. SoD controls if one user doesn't have access to both duties configured in a SoD rule. So it doesn't make much sense to create such a rule with duties that belong to the same role, as all users with that role would be violating the rule. Hence, a new Security role should be made that splits the existing role. The question is to ensure that one user cannot perform all steps in the process. Hence, separate roles need to be created AND SoD needs to be set up to ensure that users don't belong to both roles.

discussion.content: It requires 2 users with the same Customer service role to complete 2 tasks of the process. Security role give permission to perform a task but does not prevent a single user from completing the entire process. The first two abilities must be added to Segregation of duties rule to prevent both are done by the same user.
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/fin-ops-core/dev-itpro/sysadmin/tasks/set-up-segregation-duties
